Class geoLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • geoLocation
  • public class geoLocation
extends java.lang.Object
    geoLocation.java - A class that facilitates the geolocation process of the twitter API and twitter4j process. Also reads a CSV file to translate a zip code in the USA to latitude and longitude coordinates.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      geoLocation​(double rad, twitter4j.Query.Unit uni, int zip)
      Constructor for the geoLocation class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double getLatitude()
      Returns the latitude of the object, found from the input zip code.
      twitter4j.GeoLocation getLocation()
      Returns a GeoLocation class from the twitter4j refrence library with the latitude and lonmgitude of the zipcode input.
      double getLongitude()
      Returns the longitude of the object, found from the input zip code.
      double getRadius()
      Returns the radius of the object.
      twitter4j.Query.Unit getUnits()
      Returns the units that the radius is in.
      int getZipCode()
      Returns the zip code of the object.
      twitter4j.Query setGCode​(twitter4j.Query search)
      Sets the geoCode so that a query search can be performed from the location input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • geoLocation

        public geoLocation​(double rad,
                   twitter4j.Query.Unit uni,
                   int zip)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor for the geoLocation class.
        Parameters:
        rad - The radius that the user wishes to search a tweet in.
        uni - The units that the user wishes to input, either kilometers or miles.
        zip - The zipcode of the location that the user wishes to serach from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • setGCode

        public twitter4j.Query setGCode​(twitter4j.Query search)
        Sets the geoCode so that a query search can be performed from the location input.
        Parameters:
        search - The query from the twitter4j class that will be changed to incorporate geoLocation.
        Returns:
        The Query that has the geolocation put into it so that it searches by location.
